dmca.title: RKO Demands Logo Removal
dmca.body:
[RKO Logo]

Via e-mail home@earthlink.net 


January 6, 2000

Dear Sir:

	Re: Web-site Trademark infringement:  http://home.earthlink.net/~hdtv/RKOPictures.html

	Among its many valuable trademarks and service marks, RKO Radio Pictures, Inc. (RKO Pictures) owns the exclusive rights to the Corporate name as well as the famous triangle and lightening bolt and the globe and radio tower logo, all of which have long been century long symbols of RKO Pictures.

	It has recently come to my attention that your web-site has infringed upon our corporate name. 

It is not legal to use our registered name or  represent yourself as an entity of our company, nor is it free to use the globe and radio tower or triangle lightening bolt design or any other mark confusingly similar to the RKO mark or any other trademark or service mark of RKO Pictures.  Such activity infringes RKO's trademark rights and violates the Federal Trademark Act of 1946, as-amended (the Lanham Act) and other applicable laws.
	
Please consider this letter a formal request to remove the trademarked title/logo from your web-site and/or contact [private] in our rights clearance department to discuss permission for such use.  

	If you would like a copy of the United States Trademark Registration evidencing RKO Pictures' ownership of these trademarks (the "RKO Marks") please contact our office to provide us with a mailing address.

	Nothing in this letter shall be deemed a waiver of any rights or remedies of RKO Pictures, all of which are hereby expressly reserved.

	We look forward to your prompt assurances in this matter. 

Very truly yours

						[private]
						Legal Assistant

Encls.
